util
Class Similarity

java.lang.Object
  util.Similarity

public final class Similarity
extends java.lang.Object

Calculates the overall similarity between two Twitter users by computing and multiplying together the similarity between various pieces of information:

  • - the Jaccard similarity coefficient between the users each of them is following ("friends")
  • - the Jaccard similarity coefficient between the users that follow each of them ("followers")
  • - the text similarity between their biographies, using an approximation of the cosine distance (see pseudoCosine(Map, Map))
  • - the text similarity between the users they mention (using the same pseudo- cosine distance)
  • - the text similarity between their favorite tweets
  • - the text similarity between their regular tweets
    • * All these individual simlarity scores are given equal weight. Experiments or better knowledge of Twitter should make it possible to assign each a different weight and thus obtain perhaps a more reliable overall score.

    Author:
    sh

    Method Detail

    computeSumilarity

    public static SimilarityResult computeSumilarity(TwitterUser t1,
                                                 TwitterUser t2,
                                                 Tokenizer tokenizer)
    Computes the similarity between two Twitter users according to the principles outlined in the class comment.

    Parameters:
    t1 - first Twitter user instance
    t2 - second Twitter user instance
    tokenizer - tokenizer to analize the text fields collected for each user.
    Returns:
    SimilarityResult describing the similarity of the two users

    jaccardCoefficient

    public static <T> double jaccardCoefficient(java.util.Collection<T> collA,
                                            java.util.Collection<T> collB)
    The Jaccard similarity coefficient is the size of the intersection divided by the size of the union of two sets. If two sets have nothing in common, the coefficient is 0; if the sets are identical, the coefficient is 1.

    Parameters:
    collA - a collection of Comparable instances
    collB - another such collection
    Returns:
    a value between 0 and 1 indicating the similarity of the collections passed in

    pseudoCosine

    public static double pseudoCosine(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> mapA,
                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> mapB)
    Simulates the cosine metric used in vector-based information-retrieval systems by taking into account the frequency of each element in the sets passed in (as opposed to just their occurrence as in the method jaccardCoefficient(Collection, Collection)).

    Parameters:
    mapA - a map with strings as values and integers representing the frequency of their corresponding string as values
    mapB - a second such map
    Returns:
    a value between 0 and 1 indicating the similarity of the sets represented by the maps passed in.

    public static void addAllToMap(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> coll,

    Takes a collection of strings and increments the frequency of each item in the list in the corresponding map of String/Integer pairs.

    Parameters:
    coll - a colection of stringa
    map - a properly initialized map of String/Integer pairs
